title: 103_hr301
content: The Act titled "Budget Enforcement and Deficit Reduction Act of 1993" sets maximum deficit amounts and discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1994-1998. The Budget Enforcement and Deficit Reduction Act of 1993 establishes maximum deficit amounts and discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1994-1998. The maximum deficit amounts for each fiscal year are specified in the Act. The Budget Enforcement and Deficit Reduction Act of 1993 sets discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1994-1998, including specific amounts for the defense category. The Budget Enforcement and Deficit Reduction Act of 1993 sets discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1994-1998, including specific amounts for the defense category. In fiscal year 1994, $21.9 billion in new budget authority and $21 billion in outlays were allocated for the international category. The Budget Enforcement and Deficit Reduction Act of 1993 sets discretionary spending limits for fiscal years 1994-1998. For the domestic category, in fiscal year 1994, $211 billion in new budget authority and $232 billion in outlays were allocated. Adjustments for inflation are made in strict conformance with section 251 of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. Amendments to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 include changes to various sections, such as adjusting years from 1995 to 1998 in multiple provisions. Amendments are made to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. Amendments to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 include changing the dates from 1995 to 1998 in various sections. Amendments to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 involve changing dates from 1995 to 1998 in different sections, including adjustments for inflation factors and fiscal years. Amendments to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 involve changing dates from 1995 to 1998 in various sections, including adjustments for inflation factors and fiscal years. Amendments to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 involve changing dates from 1995 to 1998 in various sections, including adjustments for inflation factors and fiscal years. This includes modifications to subsections (g)(1)(C) and (h) by updating the years to 1995, 1996, 1997, or 1998. Section 254 is also amended to reflect the changes, with subsections (c) and (d)(2) being updated accordingly. Amendments to the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 involve changing dates from 1995 to 1998 in various sections. This includes updating subsections (g)(1)(C) and (h) to reflect the new years. Section 275(b) is also amended to replace "1995" with "1998".
